summary: This is an email from attorney Jason Foy to an unspecified recipient, correcting a prior statement regarding Tova Noel's knowledge about Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate requirement. Foy clarifies that Noel learned of the requirement after Epstein's suicide, not before.

persons.name: Jason Foy
persons.context: Author of the email, correcting a prior communication regarding Tova Noel's knowledge about Epstein's cellmate requirement.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Subject of the email; the communication clarifies when she learned about Epstein's requirement to have a cellmate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate; the email discusses the requirement for him to have a cellmate prior to his suicide.

connections.description: Foy is communicating about Noel, likely in a legal or representational capacity regarding events surrounding Epstein's death.
Noel was a correctional officer involved in Epstein's incarceration prior to his suicide.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide while in federal custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (implied as location of Epstein's death)
keyFacts: Attorney Jason Foy corrected a prior statement regarding Tova Noel's knowledge.
Foy clarified that Tova Noel learned Epstein was required to have a cellmate only after his suicide, not before.
The email is dated November 7, 2019, following Epstein's death in August 2019.
The correspondence suggests ongoing legal or investigative discussions about the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.
